Experience

Independent game development, which includes a lot of research, study and games being developed (like Lava-Run).

SP Game Jam 2014 in which my group was selected by the Escola Brasileira de Games (Brazillian Gaming School) for a prize for our game Jamleon.

Global Game Jam 2014 in which I participated with a group, creating Argby.

Game design study group that I organized with Jean Tomceac. Happens on the first saturday of every month at the Garoa Hacker.

Invrse, the blog devoted to game development, including workflow techniques, snippets of code, reviews of tools and game design theory.

Voluntary open-source work as a translator, localizer and developer. I’ve submitted patches to desktop environments, operating systems and browsers - if you use elementaryOS in portuguese, you are seeing part of my work in there.

Track-O-Saur development. I was responsible for the branding, logo and web design along with implementing the ecommerce system.

Nepaids (University of Sao Paulo) website & localization. I’ve designed and implemented their website using Wordpress as a backend so that they could handle updates without needing extra help. Their site has since then been integrated into the Psycology Institute’s main page.

Localization & translation of ENERQ (University of Sao Paulo). Including resumes, internal and external pages.
